articles.title: New beetle species discovered in fossilised poop of dinosaur ancestor - The Indian Express
articles.description: It was over two meters long including a long tail and neck, weighed perhaps between 15 and 20 kilos, and was a slender agile animal.
articles.content:
Researchers have discovered a 230-million-year-old beetle species by scanning a specimen of fossilised feces, or coprolites in Poland.  The findings were published last week in Current Biology.
